summary: Website for an ILF home serving homeless individuals, lower income families, people re-entering from jail, and aged-out teens
architectural_notes: Target audience: homeless individuals, lower income families, people re-entering from jail, aged-out teens

existing_features.title: Create a homepage that clearly communicates ILF Home's mission to serve homeless individuals, lower income families, people re-entering from jail, and aged-out teens
Create an 'About Us' section explaining ILF Home's purpose, values, and approach to supporting vulnerable populations
Create a 'Services' or 'Programs' section detailing specific support offerings for each target population (homeless, lower income families, jail re-entry, aged-out teens)
Create a 'Get Help' or 'Apply' section with information on how individuals can access ILF Home services and eligibility requirements
Create a 'Get Involved' or 'Support Us' section with ways for community members to donate, volunteer, or partner with ILF Home
Create a 'Contact Us' section with phone number, email, physical address, and a contact form

Apply a warm, compassionate, and professional visual design theme with earth tones or warm colors (avoiding blue and purple) that conveys trust, hope, and community support throughout the entire website
Diagnose and resolve all deployment errors preventing the application from successfully building and deploying to the Internet Computer network
Ensure all frontend imports and component references are valid with no missing dependencies or circular imports

new_feature_requests.summary: Create website for ILF home targeting homeless, lower income families, jail re-entry, and aged-out teens
Implement backend storage for contact form submissions with fields for name, email, phone number, message, and submission timestamp
Validate that all Motoko backend code follows single-actor architecture with proper type definitions and no syntax errors
